title: Cloud cost data providers are missing after the upgrade
content:
After an upgrade from 2020.08 to 2020.11, the cloud cost data providers are not seen on the UI.

Cause

System limitation.

Solution

Back up and migrate the following CMP FinOps database schemas to the DND database:

  • cmp_scheduler
  • cmp_accounts

To back up the cmp_scheduler schema, run the following command on your Postgres server:

pg_dump -U "postgres" -h "localhost" -p "5432" -d cgro -n cmp_scheduler -a -F p -b -v -f /tmp/cmp_scheduler.sql --exclude-table-data  '*.cmp_scheduler_dbcl*'

To migrate the cmp_scheduler schema data from CMP FinOps database to the DND database, run the following command on your Postgres server:

psql -U "postgres" -h "localhost" -p "5432" -d dnd -f  /tmp/cmp_scheduler.sql

To back up the cmp_accounts schema, run the following command on your Postgres server:

pg_dump -U "postgres" -h "localhost" -p "5432" -d cgro -n cmp_accounts -a -F p -b -v -f /tmp/cmp_accounts.sql --exclude-table-data  '*.cmp_accounts_dbcl*'

To migrate the cmp_accounts schema data from CMP FinOps database to the DND database, run the following command on your Postgres server:  

psql -U "postgres" -h "localhost" -p "5432" -d dnd -f  /tmp/cmp_accounts.sql

  • Replace postgres with the user name appropriate to your environment.
  • Replace localhost with the hostname or IP address appropriate to your environment.
  • Replace /tmp/ with the path appropriate to your environment for cmp_scheduler.sql and cmp_accounts.sql.
  • Replace 5432 with the port appropriate to your environment.
